title: Bloomberg era's emphasis on 'health in all policies' improved New Yorkers' heart health

title_detail.value: Bloomberg era's emphasis on 'health in all policies' improved New Yorkers' heart health

summary: From 2002 to 2013, New York City implemented a series of policies prioritizing the public's health in areas beyond traditional healthcare policies and illustrated the potential to reduce cardiovascular disease risk. This strategy is known as employing a 'health in all policies' approach. Researchers catalogued health-relevant legislation in New York City from 1998 to 2017 and found that 7.4 percent of the 3,745 pieces of legislation introduced during the Bloomberg Administration had the potential to impact New Yorkers' cardiovascular health.
